result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State takes no position.
Court grants motion to reconsider. 
Court grants request for substitution of judge in all matters.
Motion to Reconsider Defendant Amanda L. Wienzierl's Request for Substitution of Trial Judge, filed by Atty. Detert.
Hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:49 PM Defendant Amanda L Wienzierl in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called with codefendant, 22CF317.
Case called for motion to sever filed by Attorney Detert.
Attorney Detert advises the requests for substitutions filed by both parties at different times.
Attonrey Wang makes a verbal motion for the court to reconsider the denial of the substitution requests filed by both parties.
Statement by Attorney Wang.
Court stands by the original decisions.
Court will allow parties to file arguments with case law at a later date.
Statements by Attorney Detert.
Court denies the motions to reconsider.
Court addresses the motion to sever.
Arguments by Attorney Detert.
Arguments by the State.
Attorney Wang takes no position.
Further arguments by Attorney Detert.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court denies the motion to sever.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
